subject: AI & Agents
title: Why Data Quantity and Quality Both Matter
description: A short lesson to help you apply Why Data Quantity and Quality Both Matter.

hook.text: Feed a model a million blurry photos and it learns blur. Feed it a thousand sharp ones and it learns shape.

buildup.text: More data generally helps â€” but only if the data is clean, diverse, and representative.

discovery.text: Duplicate data wastes compute. Biased data teaches bias. Noisy data teaches noise.

twist.text: Small, curated datasets sometimes outperform massive, messy ones for specific tasks.

climax.text: Data-centric AI is a growing movement: improve the data, not the algorithm.

punchline.text: Quality data is the real competitive advantage in ML.

quiz.question: Why can small curated datasets outperform large messy ones?
options: Clean, representative data teaches better patterns
Smaller datasets train faster on any hardware
